title: Executive Order 7672-Withdrawal of Public Lands for the Use of the Department of Agriculture
content: OREGON
By virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by the act of June 25, 1910, ch. 421, 36 Stat. 847, as amended by the act of August 24, 1912 ch. 369, 37 Stat. 497, it is ordered as follows:

Section 1. Executive Order No. 6910, of November 26, 1934, as amended, temporarily withdrawing certain lands for classification and other purposes, is hereby revoked so far as it affects any public lands within the following-described area in Oregon:
WILLAMETTE MERIDIAN
T. 12 S., R. 11 E.,     Sec. 23, E½SW¼ and W½SE¼;     Sec. 25, all;     Sec. 26, all;     Sec. 27, S½S½;     Sec. 28, SE¼SE¼;     Sec. 34, 35, and 36.

T. 13 S., R. 11 E.,     Secs. 1, 2, and 3;     Sec. 4, NE¼NE¼, S½N½, and S½;     Sec. 8, E½SE¼;     Secs. 9 to 16, inclusive;     Sec. 17, E½NE¼, NE¼SE¼, and S½SE¼;     Sec. 20, E½, E½W½, SW¼NW¼, and W½SW¼;     Secs. 21 to 29, inclusive;     Secs. 31, S½NE¼, E½SW¼, and SE¼;     Secs. 32 to 36, inclusive.

T. 11 S., R. 12 E.,     Sec. 11, SE¼SE¼;     Sec. 12, SW¼NE¼, S½SW¼, and SE¼;     Sec. 13, all;     Sec. 14, E½;     Sec. 22, lots 1, 2, 3, and 4, NE¼SE¼, and S½SE¼;     Secs. 23, 24, 25, and 26;     Sec. 27, lots 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5, W½NE¼, NE¼NW¼, S½NW¼, SW¼, and W½ SE¼;     Sec. 28, lots 1, 2, 3, and 4, S½SW¼, and SE¼;     Sec. 29, lots 1, 2, 3, and 4;     Sec. 30, lots 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 12, SE¼SW¼, and SW¼SE¼;     Secs. 31, 32, 33, and 34;     Sec. 35, N½, SW¼ and NW¼SE¼;     Sec. 36,  and SE¼NE¼.

T. 12 S., R. 12 E.,     Sec. 2, and SW¼SE¼;     Secs. 3 to 10, inclusive;     Sec. 11, W½NE¼, W½, and SE¼;     Sec. 12, SW¼;     Sec. 18, N½NW¼;     Secs. 14 to 23, inclusive;     Sec. 25, SE¼NE¼, SE¼, and S½SW¼;     Sec. 26, N½NE¼, SW¼NE¼, W½, W½ SE¼, and SE¼SE¼;     Secs. 27 to 33, inclusive;     Sec. 34, NE¼NE¼;     Sec. 35, N½ and SE¼;     Sec. 36, N½, NW¼SW¼, W½SW¼ and SE¼.

T. 18 S., R. 12 E.,     Sec. 1, E½, E½W½, and SW¼SW¼;     Sec. 2, SW¼ and S½SE¼;     Secs. 3 to 18, inclusive;     Sec. 19, N½, SW¼, and W½SE¼;     Sec. 20, N½N½, SE¼NE¼, and E½SE¼;     Secs. 21 to 28, inclusive;     Sec. 29, E½ and E½W½;     Sec. 30, W½;     Sec. 31, lots 1, 2, and 3, NE¼NW¼, and SE¼;     Sec. 32, NE¼, E½NW¼, and S½;     Secs. 33 to 36, inclusive.

T. 11 S., R. 13 E..,     Sec. 7, S½NW¼ and S½;     Sec. 8, W½SW¼, SE¼SW¼, and SW¼ SE¼;     Sec. 12, NW¼SW¼ and S½SW¼;     Sec. 13, W½, SW¼NE¼, W½SE¼, and SE¼SE¼;     Sec. 14, SE¼SE¼;     Sec. 17, W½E½ and W½;     Secs. 18 and 19;     Sec. 20, NW¼NE¼, S½NE¼, N½SE¼, SW¼SE¼, and W½;     Sec. 23, E½NE¼;     Sec. 24, N½ and N½S½;     Sec. 29, N½NW¼, SW¼NW¼;     Sec. 30, and N½SW¼;     Sec. 35, SW¼NW¼, NW¼SW¼, E½SW¼, SE¼;     Sec. 36, W½ and SE¼.

T. 12 S., R. 13 E.,     Sec. 1, all;     Sec. 2, E½, SE¼NW¼, and E½SW¼;     Sec. 11, NE¼, E½NW¼, SW¼NW¼, and NE¼SE¼;     Secs. 12 and 13;     Sec. 14, SE¼NE¼, SE¼, and SE¼SW¼;     Sec. 23, E½ and E½W½;     Secs. 24, 25, and 26;     Sec. 27, S½N½ and S½;     Sec. 28, S½NE¼, SE¼NW¼, and S½;     Sec. 29, SW¼NE¼ and S½;     Sec. 30, SW¼NE¼, S½NW¼, and S½;     Secs. 31 to 36, inclusive.

T. 10 S., R. 14 E.,     Secs. 1, 2, and 3;     Sec.4, N½NE¼;     Sec. 10, E½, E½ W½, and NW¼;     Secs. 11 and 12;     Sec. 13, N½, E½SE¼,and W½SW¼;     Secs. 14 and 15;     Sec. 16, SE¼NE¼ and SE¼;     Sec. 20, SE¼SE¼;     Sec. 21, E½, E½SW¼, and SW¼SW¼;     Sec. 22, all;     Sec. 23, W½;     Sec. 26, W½;     Sec. 27, E½, E½W½, and NW¼NW¼;     Sec. 28, NE¼NE¼;     Sec. 31, E½SE¼;     Sec. 32, W½SW¼;     Sec. 33, SE¼ and NE¼NE¼;     Secs. 34 and 35.

T. 11 S., R. 14 E.,     Sec. 1, W½NE¼, NW¼, N½SW¼, and SW¼SW¼;     Secs. 2 and 3;     Sec. 4, E½;     Sec. 5, NW¼NE¼, S½NE¼, SE¼, and W½;     Sec. 6, E½E½, W½NE¼, and SW¼SE¼;     Sec. 7, E½, S½NW¼, N½SW¼, and SE¼ SW¼;     Secs. 8, 9, and 10;     Sec. 11, N½ and SW¼;     Sec. 12, W½NW¼     Sec. 14, W½ and W½SE¼;     Secs. 15, 16 and 17;     Sec. 18, E½, E½W½, and SW¼SW¼;     Secs. 19, 20, 21, and 22;     Sec. 23, W½ and W½E½;     Sec. 26, W½;     Sec. 27, all;     Sec. 28, E½ and E½W½;     Sec. 30, E½, E½W½, and W½NW¼;     Sec. 31, W½E½, SE¼SE¼, and SW¼;     Sec. 32, E½SE¼, SW¼SE¼, and SW¼SW¼;     Sec. 33, E½, E½W½, SW¼NW¼, and W½ SW¼;     Sec. 34, all;     Sec. 35, and S½SE¼.

T. 12 S., R. 14 E.,     Sec. 1, lot 4;     Sec. 2, N½NE¼, SW¼NE¼, W½, and SW¼ SE¼;     Secs. 3 to 11, inclusive;     Sec. 12, N½, SW¼, and W½SE¼;     Sec. 13, W½, and W½E½;     Secs. 14 to 23, inclusive;     Sec. 24, W½ and W½E½;     Sec. 25, W½ and W½E½;     Secs. 26 to 36, inclusive.
T. 9 S., R. 15 E.,     Sec. 31, SE¼SW¼.
T. 10 S., R. 15 E.,     Sec. 6, and SW¼SE¼;     Sec. 18, lot 4.

Section 2. Subject to the conditions expressed in the above-mentioned acts and to all valid existing rights, all vacant, unappropriated, and unreserved public lands within the above-described area are hereby temporarily withdrawn from settlement, location, sale, or entry, and reserved and set apart for use and development by the Department of Agriculture for soli erosion control and other land utilization activities in connection with the Central Oregon Land Project, LA-OR 2: Provided, that nothing herein contained shall restrict prospecting, locating, developing, mining, entering, leasing, or patenting the mineral resources of the lands under the applicable laws.

Section 3. This order shall be applicable to all lands within the area described in Section 1 hereof upon the cancellation, termination, or release of prior entries, selections, rights, appropriations, or claims, or upon the revocation of prior withdrawals, unless expressly otherwise provided in the order of revocation.
Section 4. The reservation made by Section 2 of this order shall remain In force until revoked by the President or by act of Congress.
FRANKLIN D ROOSEVELT
The White House,July 19, 1937.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 7672-Withdrawal of Public Lands for the Use of the Department of Agriculture Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/369054
